intro: Paracaryum sintenisii f. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf form of the African violet, is a cultivar characterized by its larger, broader leaves compared to the typical form. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features dense, velvety foliage and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This variety is popular among indoor gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of care.
